text: Fenbeasts are magical constructs made from foul mud and rotting wood. Powered by a shard of an Ogham Stone, they are said to be animated by the souls of those who perished in the swamps.
Fimm Warriors riding to war upon the backs of Bog Beasts – daemonic servant-creatures from the dark depths of the swamps.
Despite lacking depth perception, the Fimir are remarkably adept at hurling javelins at their enemies.
Every Fimir clan has a small cabal of apprentice Balefiends who serve directly under the tutelage of the Meargh.
Dirachs, known as “Daemon-Friends”, are second only to the Meargh in sorcery, shaping the very weather of the marshes to aid their foul cause.
Finmor are lesser Fimir nobles who aspire to earn the honour of leading their own raiding parties or bands of Fimm Warriors.
The Fianna are the elite of the Fimm Warriors – hand-picked, sometimes at birth, sometimes for deeds of great renown.
The highest-ranking member of the noble caste usually leads the Fimir army in the field - and that's always the strongest of them.
Skattach, one of the most powerful Mearghs – witch-queens of the Fimir – has claimed the mantle of Hell-Mother, ruler of all clans.
Horrifying, flayed amalgams of man and horse. Once they emerge from their watery refuges, only destruction can sate their merciless crusade.
A powerful daemon bound within the body of a Fimir Warrior. The possessed grows to monstrous size, its limbs twisting into cruel blades.
Long-time servants and allies of the Fimir, Swamp Daemons stalk through the waters, unseen until they strike.
A ruined tower, home to one of Balor’s foul servants, serving as a wandering shrine to He of the Killing Eye.
These veteran riders of the Fimir strike fast and hard, delivering a painful sting to the enemy’s flanks.
The name of the Fimir Warrior who hosted the daemon is long forgotten, but his monstrous form became the Dirachs’ most terrible creation.
Nightmarish creatures that have haunted and terrorized the moors of Basker for centuries.
Boglars have forged a pact with the cyclopean creatures and now fight at their side – why the Fimir would ally with such wretched beings remains a mystery.
Devoted to the Daemon Prince Balor, these fanatics worship their god blindly.
Fanatic unto death. With their clans destroyed, they raid and pillage with the sole purpose of killing in cruel ways.
Rumours tell of creatures dwelling near a haunted, icy lake in northern Albion – the locals call them Gharnu’s Daemon-Friends.
Tall as a Troll and easily as strong, Mistmor are prized defenders of Fimir settlements.
The Fianna are the elite of the Fimm Warriors – hand-picked, sometimes at birth, sometimes for deeds of great renown.
Sometimes found leading bands of Orcs and Goblins, these guards are dangerous enough even when encountered alone.
The slave caste of the Fimir. Though lowly in rank, Shearls are still fearsome foes.
They terrorize the swamps, stalking livestock and lonely travellers until summoned by the Fimir – whereupon they feast well on battlefield carrion.
When the Killing Eye clan was left without a leader, its Fimm retinues set out to seek a new Meargh – or their ultimate annihilation.
Some Boglars are born with an innate gift for sorcery, earning them a place of command within their tribes.
Once caught by a Bog Octopus’s tentacle, few but the strongest creatures can escape its crushing grasp.
Mighty Daemon Princess and Mother of the Bog Octopuses, worshipped by all Fimir.
Abominable amphibians bred for war by the Fimir.
